solution.text:
We know that the sum of interior angles of a parallelogram add up to \(360^o\), and also there are 2 pairs of equal angles each.
Let these 2 angles be \(x\) and \(y\)
Hence, \(2x + 2y=360\)
\(x+y=180\), hence if x is obtuse \((x\gt90)\), y has to be acute \((y\lt90)\)
Thus if one pair of the angles are obtuse, the other pair of angles would have to be acute to satisfy the sum of the interior angles to be \(360^o\).
Hence the maximum number of obtuse angles a parallelogram can have is 2.

content.text: What is the maximum number of obtuse angles a parallelogram can have?
